INVESTIGATION:
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4159 Youth restraint; pregnant youth; reduction,
Section prevention; prohibited restraints; elimination of restraints.
Description
2

(5) In the event a restraint occurs, it must be performed in a
manner that is safe, appropriate, and proportionate to the severity
of the youth’s behavior, chronological and developmental age,
size, gender, physical condition, medical condition, psychiatric
condition, and personal history, including any history of trauma,
and must be done in a manner consistent with the youth’s
treatment plan.
Allegation Youth's left arm was hurt during restraint.
Investigation Interviews:
Complaint was interviewed by telephone on December 20, 2022,
and reported they had no further information.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on December
19, 2022. Youth A refused to talk with DHHS Worker, so I met with
Youth A alone. Youth A stated while in a restraint she pulled a
muscle. Youth A described Supervisor having Youth A’s arm in the
“regular position, like before” but it hurt. Youth A stated the nurse
examined her arm after the restraint and she has seen the nurse
multiple times. Youth A did not indicate what shoulder and refused to
answer any more questions regarding the restraint.
Supervisor was interviewed face to face at the facility on
December 19, 2022, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Supervisor
described having Youth A in a benevolent restraint. Supervisor stated
there was hardly any pressure on Youth A’s arm. Supervisor denied
Youth A saying her arm hurt during the restraint or after the restraint.
Supervisor stated Staff 3 witnessed the restraint and Supervisor asked
Staff 3 “this good, this good?” meaning the restraint. Supervisor stated
Staff 3 told her the restraint looked good.
Nurse was interviewed face to face at the facility on December 19,
2022, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Nurse reported examining
Youth A on December 6, 2022, the same day of the restraint. Nurse
stated Youth A had full range of motion with her right arm and no
bruising. Nurse stated Youth A did have muscle pain in her upper arm
and was given ibuprofen and ice.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on December 19,
2022, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Staff 1 described walking
into the gym and seeing Supervisor and Staff 3 place Youth A in a
benevolent restraint. Staff 1 denied seeing any concerns with how the
restraint looked. Staff 1 reported she spoke with Youth A after the
restraint and Youth A did not say anything about her arm hurting.
4

Staff 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on December 19,
2022, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Staff 2 reported she
witnessed Supervisor initiate the restraint with Youth A in the gym.
Staff 2 described it as a benevolent restraint and did not see any
concerns with how Supervisor was holding Youth A. Staff 2 denied
hearing Youth A say anything about her arm hurting.
Staff 3 was interviewed via Teams on December 20, 2022, in
collaboration with DHHS Worker. Staff 3 described Supervisor
placing Youth A in a benevolent restraint. Staff 3 denied having any
concerns with how the restraint was conducted. Staff 3 reported Youth
A told Staff 3 later that day her right shoulder hurt. Staff 3 stated Youth
A was given ibuprofen and ice. Staff 3 stated she witnessed Youth A
have full range of motion in her arm as Youth A was “chucking CDs
across the room later that day.”
Documents Reviewed:
• Eagle Village Health Care Visit Report dated 12/06/22: “Youth A
was seen for right arm pain starting after being in a hold. Full
ROM of shoulder and elbow without pain, no bruising was seen,
and numbness/tingling was denied. She did have muscle pain of
her upper arm on palpation.” It should be noted the allegations
are of left shoulder pain. Youth A complained of right shoulder
pain, so the right shoulder was examined.
• Incident Report 145620196 was consistent with how Supervisor,
Staff 1, Staff 2, Staff 3, and Youth A described the restraint in the
interviews.
• Supervisor, Staff 2, and Staff 3’s personnel files: There were no
disciplinary records, and the required Aegis training was
completed on 05/23/22.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance as Youth A, Supervisor, Staff 1, Staff
2, and Staff 3 described the benevolent restraint being done properly
and not having any concerns. Youth A was examined by the Nurse the
same day and denied having shoulder pain. Youth A did have muscle
pain in her upper arm and was given ibuprofen and ice.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4160 Emergency restraint.
Section Rule 160. The use of emergency restraint as a lifesaving response
Description for a youth will be limited to: (a) An emergency response to
protect the youth or others from an unanticipated or severely
aggressive behavior that places the youth or others at serious
threat of violence or injury if no immediate intervention occurs.
4

Allegation Youth was restrained for 8 minutes because they were attempting to go
outside in the cold. This was not an isolated incident. There are
concerns about the number of staff restraining the youth and the
frequency throughout the week in which they are restrained.
Investigation Interviews:
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on December
19, 2022. Youth A refused to talk with DHHS Worker, so I met with
Youth A alone. Youth A reported she was in a restraint for 8 minutes
with Supervisor. Youth A stated she was restrained because she went
after a peer because the peer told her she was going to “beat her
ass.” Youth A refused to answer any more questions regarding the
restraint.
Therapist was interviewed face to face at the facility on December
19, 2022, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Therapist described
Youth A struggling at the facility and acting out more in the past two
months. Therapist stated she feels Youth A needs a more secure
placement. Therapist reported a psychiatric setting may be the best for
Youth A. Therapist reported Youth A has been attempting to run into
the road and jump in front of cars leading to multiple restraints.
Therapist stated it is not safe for Youth A or for others. Therapist
believes issues with Youth A’s post placement and some medications
changes may be contributing to the behavior concerns.
Supervisor was interviewed face to face at the facility on
December 20, 2022, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Supervisor
described seeing Staff 1 stand in-between Youth A and Youth A’s peer
because Youth A was attempting to assault her peer. Supervisor
stated she had Staff 1 take Youth A’s peer and other youth into the
weight room away from the situation. Supervisor reported Youth A was
escalated, screaming, and wanted to leave the gym. Supervisor stated
she heard Youth A making suicidal statements. Supervisor reported
earlier Youth A had laid in the middle of 170th Avenue wanting to die
and a few days prior to that ran toward the road and attempted to jump
in front of an oncoming vehicle. Supervisor reported Staff 2 was
standing in front of the door and Youth A started pushing and swinging
at Staff 2, so Supervisor placed Youth A in a benevolent restraint.
Supervisor stated the restraint was less than ten minutes. Supervisor
stated she was concerned Youth A was going to go to the road again,
lay down in the road or attempt to jump in front of traffic. Supervisor
reported Youth A has been in multiple restraints recently for unsafe
behavior.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on December 19,
2022, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Staff 1 described walking
4

into the gym and seeing Supervisor and Staff 3 place Youth A in a
benevolent restraint. Staff 1 stated she moved the other youth that
were in the gym to the weight room, so they were away from the
restraint. Staff 1 stated Youth A was loud, swearing and moving
aggressively toward Staff 2. Staff 1 reported being aware Youth A had
left the school earlier and went down 170th Avenue to US 10 and laid in
the road. Staff 1 stated she felt the restraint was warranted.
Staff 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on December 19,
2022, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Staff 2 described seeing
Youth A yelling at a peer and Youth A threatening that peer. Staff 2
stated Youth A’s behaviors continued to escalate as she was
screaming and yelling. Staff 2 reported Supervisor told Staff 2 to cover
the emergency door while also telling Youth A to calm down and take a
breath. Staff 2 stated Youth A came at her telling Staff 2 to “get out of
my way.” Staff 2 described Youth A having her arms extended,
pushing Staff 2, and sweeping Staff 2’s feet causing Staff 2 to lose
balance. Staff 2 stated she did not remember Youth A swinging at her,
but a co-worker said Youth A did punch Staff 2. Staff 2 reported she
does not work at the same house where Youth A lives so does not have
regular contact with Youth A.
Staff 3 was interviewed via Teams on December 20, 2022, in
collaboration with DHHS Worker. Staff 3 stated Youth A told Staff 3
she was going to “beat the shit out of her peer.” Staff 3 described that
peer walking into the gym, so Staff 3 stepped in between Youth A and
Youth A’s peer. Staff 3 stated the other youth were moved into the
weight room while Youth A was screaming and yelling. Staff 3 reported
Supervisor told Staff 2 and Staff 3 not to let Youth A out of the gym.
Staff 3 described Staff 2 standing in front of the doors and Youth A
pushing and kicking Staff 2. Staff 3 stated Supervisor placed Youth A
in a restraint at that time. Staff 3 reported the restraint lasted less than
ten minutes. Staff 3 stated earlier in the day Youth A had some
behavior issues and “beat the crap out of a peer.”
Youth B was interviewed via telephone on January 9, 2023, in
collaboration with DHHS Worker. Youth B described the facility
being chaotic at times with youth throwing and breaking things. Youth
B stated staff do what they should and keep youth safe.
Documents Reviewed:
• Incident Reports from September 1, 2022 – December 16, 2022,
for Youth A. Youth A was restrained twice in September, once in
October, six times in November and three times in December.
From review of the incident reports, it appears all of the
restraints were warranted. The most recent restraints occurred
4

due to Youth A attempting to run into the road, jump in front on
oncoming vehicles and laying down in the middle of the road.
The restraints describe staff having to use their bodies to shield
Youth A from cars, directing traffic to go around Youth A
because she is laying in the middle of the road and refusing to
move and some occasions of staff standing between Youth A
and the busy highway.
• Incident report 145620196 was consistent with how Supervisor,
Staff 1, Staff 2, Staff 3, and Youth A described why the restraint
occurred.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance as in this situation Supervisor
assessed the threat of serious injury to Youth A if Supervisor did not
intervene. Supervisor reported hearing Youth A make suicidal
comments and Youth A had previous multiple attempts of running
toward the road, laying in the middle of the road and attempting to jump
in front of vehicles.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules and/or MISEP requirements and/or contract and policy.
It is recommended that the current license status be continued.
